quotes.quote: How much easier it is to be critical than to be correct.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: Asking a working writer what he thinks about critics is like asking a lamppost how it feels about dogs.
quotes.author: Christopher Hampton

quotes.quote: Any fool can criticize, condemn, and complain - and most fools do.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: If you are not criticized, you may not be doing much.
quotes.author: Donald H. Rumsfeld

quotes.quote: After all, one knows one's weak points so well, that it's rather bewildering to have the critics overlook them and invent others.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: To avoid criticism do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway. You'll be damned if you do, and damned if you don't.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Honest criticism is hard to take, particularly from a relative, a friend, an acquaintance, or a stranger.
quotes.author: Franklin P. Jones

quotes.quote: No degree of dullness can safeguard a work against the determination of critics to find it fascinating.
quotes.author: Harold Rosenberg

quotes.quote: Now, in reality, the world have paid too great a compliment to critics, and have imagined them to be men of much greater profundity than they really are.
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.quote: Pay no attention to what the critics say... Remember, a statue has never been set up in honor of a critic!
quotes.author: Jean Sibelius

quotes.quote: Against criticism a man can neither protest nor defend himself; he must act in spite of it, and then it will gradually yield to him.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Any reviewer who expresses rage and loathing for a novel is preposterous. He or she is like a person who has put on full armor and attacked a hot fudge sundae.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.quote: Never criticize a man until you've walked a mile in his moccasins.
quotes.author: Native American Proverb

quotes.quote: I never met anybody who said when they were a kid, "I wanna grow up and be a critic."
quotes.author: Richard Pryor

quotes.quote: One cannot review a bad book without showing off.
quotes.author: W. H. Auden

quotes.quote: People ask for criticism, but they only want praise.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham
